Metadata: "Piscirickettsi​a salmonis", a major pathogen of salmonid fish in Chile

Piscirickettsio​sis has resulted in extensive losses among salmonid fishes cultured in southern Chile. Near Puerto Montt, recurring epizootics have frequently resulted in mortality approaching 90% among the coho salmon cultured there. Three other salmonids reared in these waters are also subject to the disease. A unique rickettsial agent, "Piscirickettsi​a salmonis", has been isolated and demonstrated to be the causative agent of piscirickettsio​sis. The obligately intracellular nature of "P. salmonis" and its occurrence only in salt water suggest that a natural reservoir of infection is maintained; identification of this source of infection and elucidation of the natural mode(s) of transmission of the agent are high research priorities.
